video.title: The Future is Serverless: What That Means for Node.js
video.description:
Serverless computing is sweeping the cloud industry and transforming how we're building applications on the cloud. Node.js has been the first language each of the major serverless providers has supported from day 1. Node.js applications written for serverless are changing from their "server"ed past. We'll discuss why serverless went Node.js first, what impact this will have on Node.js developers, and finally, what consequences this might have on Node.js's ecosystem.

Talk given by Chris Anderson at Node Summit 2017.

Thanks to Node Summit for giving us permission to post this talk. freeCodeCamp is not associated with this talk. We're just excited to bring more exposure to to it!

topLevelComment.text: Can someone give a comprehensive definition of serverless? Also, what's the advantage over running your own server?

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text:
Here is a video that talks about what serverless is: https://youtu.be/un8-zGFXEfU
One advantage of NOT running your own server is security. There are new ways to hack servers being discovered all the time. It can be better to let security professionals make sure that servers are secure instead of trying to do it yourself.
